text: Sufi Abu Taleb ( ; January 27, 1925 â€“ February 21, 2008) was an Egyptian politician. He was Speaker of the People's Assembly from 1978 to 1983 and, following the assassination of Anwar El Sadat on 6 October 1981, he became acting head of state for eight days, until Hosni Mubarak took power. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Presidents of Egypt
title: Sufi Abu Taleb
